scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two autograph letters from A.R. Pendleton, Winchester, Virginia, to members of the Conrad family. In the earliest letter, June 11, 1913, to [Major Holmes] Conrad, a member of General Thomas L. Rosser's Cavalry Division, Pendleton compliments Conrad on his fine address of the sixth and tells him that many others, more qualified to judge its merits than himself, also appreciated the speech. A.R. Pendleton, Hotel Marseilles, New York City, also writes to Major Conrad's son, Robert Conrad, November 16, 1915, thanking him for a copy of Leigh Robinson's memorial to Major Holmes Conrad. Both letters are associated with a mimeographed broadside In Memoriam Major Holmes Conradcopyrighted by the Confederate Veterans Association, Washington, D.C., November 2, 1915.
